recipesJson.name: Layerz - Moscato  Nectar
recipesJson.author: Deetzz
recipesJson.description:
I created this recipe using my "Moscato Liquido" layer. 

I wanted to use my Moscato layer in a Fruit Juice but did not want to do the average Grapple or some thin kind of fruit juice. I figured a Tropical vibe would be weird enough with a Grape layer and gave it a try.

This turned out very tasty! A strange and delicious mix that I can only describe as a Pink or slight red Tropical fruit Juice with a unique mouth watering grape twist to it.

The Pink - The combination of the Shisha strawberry and FLV Pink Guava is where I got the tropical notes from. The Shisha melting the tropical guava and Citrus notes down into a sweet nectar that mixes into the Grape layer.

WS23 - added to bring in the cool Beverage boost

Sweetner - Yes add it. the profile is not the same if you leave it out. I would say the lowest the SS should go is 0.25... LOWEST!

Give this a Mix if you are looking for something fresh

ShakeNVape This!!

Changes: If you like a longer lasting Guava, Add some CAP Sweet Guava to this!

reviews.text: This is awesome! It’s a very sweet and very juicy tropical strawberry, guava, and white white grape fruit punch. This is much, much better than the Cheap Date. Even though it has what looks like a scary amount of Moscato to me, it’s combined with other strong flavors that stomps down that laundry room sort of floral into nonexistence, though it does taste like there’s a bit of lychee in here, that works with a tropical punch. There’s some magic going on here in that the pink grapefruit citrus quality of the Pink Guava is pushed or pulled down, but the bit of tropical funkiness comes through. I think the Shisha Strawberry is doing a lot of the heavy lifting here. Strawberry and guava is a great combination, first of all, but it makes me want to explore more things that combine Shisha Strawberry with Moscato. It’s almost like a tropical version of strawberry wine. It seems like you could use that pairing, maybe with some FLV Oak Barrel and a touch of FLV Sangria and make a traditional strawberry wine, which might be amazing. The apples and pear just sort of fade into the fruity body the way apple juice is a benign component in a lot of fruit punches. If this were a Capri Sun flavor, I’d guzzle it, just like I’ve been guzzling this slightly weird but wonderful juice.
